018package org.tquadrat.foundation.xml.parse;
019
020import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
021import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
023
024import java.io.BufferedReader;
025import java.io.IOException;
026import java.io.InputStreamReader;
027import java.net.URL;
028import java.util.HashMap;
029import java.util.Map;
030
031import org.apiguardian.api.API;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
033import org.xml.sax.Attributes;
034import org.xml.sax.ContentHandler;
035import org.xml.sax.DTDHandler;
036import org.xml.sax.EntityResolver;
037import org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler;
038import org.xml.sax.InputSource;
039import org.xml.sax.Locator;
040import org.xml.sax.SAXException;
041import org.xml.sax.SAXNotRecognizedException;
042import org.xml.sax.SAXNotSupportedException;
043import org.xml.sax.XMLReader;
044import org.xml.sax.helpers.AttributesImpl;
045import org.xml.sax.helpers.LocatorImpl;
046
047/**
048 *  This class is an abstract base implementation for a XMLReader. Use this
049 *  class as a base class for SAX based parsers that will parse other formats
050 *  than XML. This is quite useful in combination with XSLT. Refer to the
051 *  description for the abstract method
052 *  {@link #process(BufferedReader) process()}
053 *  for a brief run-through how to use this class.
054 *
055 *  @see "'Java and XSLT' from Eric M. Burke, O'Reilly 2001"
056 *
057 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
058 *  @version $Id: AbstractXMLReader.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $
059 *  @since 0.0.5
060 *
061 *  @UMLGraph.link
062 */
063@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
064@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: AbstractXMLReader.java 840 2021-01-10 21:37:03Z tquadrat $" )
065@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
066public abstract class AbstractXMLReader implements XMLReader
067{
068        /*-----------*\
069    ====** Constants **========================================================
070        \*-----------*/
071    /**
072     *  An empty attribute set.
073     */
074    public static final Attributes NO_ATTRIBUTES = new AttributesImpl();
075
076        /*------------*\
077    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
078        \*------------*/
079    /**
080     *  The content handler that provides the data to parse.
081     */
082    private ContentHandler m_ContentHandler;
083
084    /**
085     *  The DTD handler used by this XMLReader; usually {@code null}.
086     */
087    private DTDHandler m_DTDHandler;
088
089    /**
090     *  The encoding that is used for the input source. If {@code null},
091     *  the platform specific encoding will be used.
092     */
093    private String m_Encoding = null;
094
095    /**
096     *  The entity resolver that is used by this XMLReader. It is especially
097     *  used by
098     *  {@link #parse(InputSource) parse( InputSource )}.
099     */
100    private EntityResolver m_EntityResolver;
101
102    /**
103     *  The error handler that is used by this XMlReader.
104     */
105    private ErrorHandler m_ErrorHandler;
106
107    /**
108     *  The features that are supported by this XMLReader.
109     */
110    private final Map<String,Boolean> m_Features = new HashMap<>();
111
112    /**
113     *  The locator that is maintained by this XML reader.
114     */
115    private final LocatorImpl m_Locator = new LocatorImpl();
116
117    /**
118     *  The properties that are set for this XMLReader.
119     */
120    private final Map<String,Object> m_Properties = new HashMap<>();
121
122        /*--------------*\
123    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
124        \*--------------*/
125    /**
126     *  The default constructor.
127     */
128    protected AbstractXMLReader()
129    {
130        setErrorHandler( null );
131    }   //  AbstractXMLReader()
132
133    /**
134     *  Creates a new instance of AbstractXMLReader and assigns the given
135     *  content handler.
136     *
137     *  @param  contentHandler  The content handler to use with this XMLReader.
138     */
139    protected AbstractXMLReader( final ContentHandler contentHandler )
140    {
141        this();
142
143        setContentHandler( requireNonNullArgument( contentHandler, "contentHandler" ) );
144    }   //  AbstractXMLReader()
145
146        /*---------*\
147    ====** Methods **==========================================================
148        \*---------*/
149    /**
150     *  Creates a buffered reader from the given input source.
151     *
152     *  @param  input   The input source.
153     *  @return The buffered reader for the input data.
154     *  @throws IOException Unable to create a reader from the input source.
155     *  @throws SAXException    Unable to interpret the data provided with the
156     *      input source.
157     */
158    @SuppressWarnings( "resource" )
159    private BufferedReader createReader( final InputSource input ) throws IOException, SAXException
160    {
161        //---* Create a buffered reader from the input source *----------------
162        BufferedReader retValue = null;
163        //noinspection IfStatementWithTooManyBranches
164        if( nonNull( input.getCharacterStream() ) )
165        {
166            retValue = new BufferedReader( input.getCharacterStream() );
167        }
168        else if( nonNull( input.getByteStream() ) )
169        {
170            retValue = new BufferedReader( nonNull( m_Encoding ) ? new InputStreamReader( input.getByteStream(), m_Encoding ) : new InputStreamReader( input.getByteStream() ) );
171        }
172        else if( nonNull( input.getSystemId() ) )
173        {
174            final var entityResolver = getEntityResolver();
175            if( nonNull( entityResolver ) )
176            {
177                //---* Use the entity resolver to get the reader *-------------
178                retValue = createReader( entityResolver.resolveEntity( input.getPublicId(), input.getSystemId() ) );
179            }
180            else
181            {
182                /*
183                 * If no entity resolver is set, the system id that is stored
184                 * in an InputSource will be taken directly as a fully
185                 * qualified URL to a stream somewhere. Otherwise it will be
186                 * translated using that entity resolver.
187                 */
188                final var url = new URL( input.getSystemId() );
189                retValue = new BufferedReader( nonNull( m_Encoding ) ? new InputStreamReader( url.openStream(), m_Encoding ) : new InputStreamReader( url.openStream() ) );
190            }
191        }
192        else
193        {
194            //---* Something is weird with this input source *-----------------
195            throw new SAXException( "Invalid Input Source" );
196        }
197
198        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
199        return retValue;
200    }   //  createReader()
201
202    /**
203     *  Returns the current content handler.
204     *
205     *  @return A reference to the current content handler.
206     *
207     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#getContentHandler()
208     */
209    @Override
210    public final ContentHandler getContentHandler() { return m_ContentHandler; }
211
212    /**
213     *  Returns the current DTD handler.
214     *
215     *  @return A reference to the current DTD handler.
216     *
217     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#getDTDHandler()
218     */
219    @Override
220    public final DTDHandler getDTDHandler() { return m_DTDHandler; }
221
222    /**
223     *  Returns the current entity resolver.
224     *
225     *  @return A reference to the current entity resolver.
226     *
227     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#getEntityResolver()
228     */
229    @Override
230    public final EntityResolver getEntityResolver() { return m_EntityResolver; }
231
232    /**
233     *  Returns the current error handler. It will never return
234     *  {@code null}; in case no handler was set, a reference to an
235     *  instance of
236     *  {@link DefaultErrorHandler DefaultErrorHandler}
237     *  will be returned.
238     *
239     *  @return A reference to the current error handler.
240     *
241     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#getErrorHandler()
242     */
243    @Override
244    public final ErrorHandler getErrorHandler() { return m_ErrorHandler; }
245
246    /**
247     *  {@inheritDoc}
248     *  As this is not meant as a base for an <i>XML</i> parser, this
249     *  implementation does not recognise the required namespaces. If this is
250     *  needed, the derived class has to provide another implementation  for
251     *  {@code getFeature()}
252     *  and
253     *  {@link #setFeature(String, boolean) setFeature()}.
254     *
255     *  @param  name    The name of the feature.
256     *  @return {@code true} if the feature is supported,
257     *      {@code false} if not or if the name is unknown.
258     *  @throws SAXNotRecognizedException   The feature value cannot be
259     *      retrieved.
260     *  @throws SAXNotSupportedException    The XMLReader recognizes the
261     *      feature name but cannot determine its value at this time.
262     *
263     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#getFeature(java.lang.String)
264     */
265    @Override
266    public boolean getFeature( final String name ) throws SAXNotRecognizedException, SAXNotSupportedException
267    {
268        final var feature = m_Features.get( requireNonNullArgument( name, "name" ) );
269        final var retValue = nonNull( feature ) && feature.booleanValue();
270
271        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
272        return retValue;
273    }   //  getFeature()
274
275    /**
276     *  Returns the value for the property with the given name. Usually, this
277     *  property name is any fully-qualified URI. It is possible for an
278     *  XMLReader to recognise a property name but temporarily be unable to
279     *  return its value. Some property values may be available only in
280     *  specific contexts, such as before, during, or after a parse.<br>
281     *  <br>XMLReaders are not required to recognize any specific property
282     *  names, though an initial core set is documented for SAX2. But even that
283     *  is not supported by this specific implementation; if this is a
284     *  requirement, a derived class has to provide its own implementation of
285     *  {@code getProperty()}
286     *  and
287     *  {@link #setProperty(String, Object) setProperty()}.
288     *
289     *  @param  name    The property name, which is a fully-qualified URI.
290     *  @return The current value of the property. If the name is not known,
291     *      {@code null} will be returned instead of throwing an
292     *      exception.
293     *
294     *  @throws SAXNotRecognizedException   The property value can't be
295     *      retrieved.
296     *  @throws SAXNotSupportedException    The XMLReader recognizes the
297     *      property name but cannot determine its value at this time.
298     *
299     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#getProperty(java.lang.String)
300     *  @see #setProperty(String, Object) setProperty()
301     */
302    @Override
303    public Object getProperty( final String name ) throws SAXNotRecognizedException, SAXNotSupportedException
304    {
305        return m_Properties.get( requireNonNullArgument( name, "name" ) );
306    }   //  getProperty()
307
308    /**
309     *  Returns a reference to the locator object provided by this base
310     *  implementation.
311     *
312     *  @return The reference to the locator object.
313     */
314    protected final Locator getLocator() { return m_Locator; }
315
316    /**
317     *  Parses an input data source.<br>
318     *  <br>The application can use this method to instruct the XML reader to
319     *  begin parsing a document from any valid input source (a character
320     *  stream, a byte stream, or a URI).<br>
321     *  <br>Applications may not invoke this method while a parse is in
322     *  progress (they should create a new XMLReader instead for each nested
323     *  document). Once a parse is complete, an application may reuse the same
324     *  XMLReader object, possibly with a different input source. Configuration
325     *  of the XMLReader object (such as handler bindings and values
326     *  established for feature flags and properties) is unchanged by
327     *  completion of a parse, unless the definition of that aspect of the
328     *  configuration explicitly specifies other behavior (For example,
329     *  feature flags or properties exposing characteristics of the document
330     *  being parsed).<br>
331     *  <br>During the parse, the XMLReader will provide information about the
332     *  document through the registered event handlers.<br>
333     *  <br>This method is synchronous: it will not return until parsing has
334     *  ended. If a client application wants to terminate parsing early, it
335     *  should throw an exception.<br>
336     *  <br>This implementation calls
337     *  {@link #process(BufferedReader) process()}
338     *  which is the user provided implementation for the parser.<br>
339     *  <br>If no content handler is set, this method returns immediately
340     *  without any error message.
341     *
342     *  @param  input   The input source for the top-level of the document.
343     *  @throws IOException An IO exception from the parser, possibly from a
344     *      byte stream or character stream supplied by the application.
345     *  @throws SAXException    Any SAX exception, possibly wrapping another
346     *      exception.
347     *
348     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#parse(org.xml.sax.InputSource)
349     *  @see org.xml.sax.InputSource
350     *  @see #parse(java.lang.String) parse( String )
351     *  @see #setEntityResolver(EntityResolver) setEntityResolver()
352     *  @see #setDTDHandler(DTDHandler) setDTDHandler()
353     *  @see #setContentHandler(ContentHandler) setContentHandler()
354     *  @see #setErrorHandler(ErrorHandler) setErrorHandler()
355     */
356    @Override
357    public final void parse( final InputSource input ) throws IOException, SAXException
358    {
359        final var contentHandler = getContentHandler();
360        if( nonNull( contentHandler ) )
361        {
362            //---* Sets the locator *------------------------------------------
363            /*
364             * m_Locator will never be null.
365             */
366            contentHandler.setDocumentLocator( m_Locator );
367
368            //---* Obtain a reader from the input source *---------------------
369            try( final var reader = createReader( requireNonNullArgument( input, "input" ) ) )
370            {
371                //---* Let someone else do the work *--------------------------
372                process( reader );
373            }
374        }
375    }   //  parse()
376
377    /**
378     *  Parses an XML document from a system identifier (URI).<br>
379     *  <br>This method is a shortcut for the common case of reading a
380     *  document from a system identifier. It is the exact equivalent of the
381     *  following:<br>
382     *  {@code parse( new InputSource( systemId ) );}<br>
383     *  <br>If the system identifier is a URL, it must be fully resolved by
384     *  the application before it is passed to the parser.
385     *
386     *  @param  systemId    The system identifier (URI).
387     *  @throws IOException An IO exception from the parser, possibly from a
388     *      byte stream or character stream supplied by the application.
389     *  @throws SAXException    Any SAX exception, possibly wrapping another
390     *      exception.
391     *
392     *  @see #parse(org.xml.sax.InputSource) parse( InputSource )
393     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#parse(java.lang.String)
394     */
395    @Override
396    public final void parse( final String systemId ) throws IOException, SAXException { parse( new InputSource( systemId ) ); }
397
398    /**
399     *  This method has to be implemented in order to perform the parsing. It
400     *  will be called either from
401     *  {@link #parse(String) parse( String )}
402     *  or
403     *  {@link #parse(InputSource) parse( InputSource )}.<br>
404     *  <br>The implementation of this method should update the locator by
405     *  appropriate calls to
406     *  {@link #setPublicId(String) setPublicId()},
407     *  {@link #setSystemId(String) setSystemId()},
408     *  and
409     *  {@link #setLocation(int, int) setLocation()} -
410     *  if possible ...<br>
411     *  <br>The input is not meant to be XML, so it is difficult to describe
412     *  here how to parse the input. But assuming that the input stream is a
413     *  Java properties file, the implementation for {@code process()} might
414     *  look like this:
415     *  <pre><code>
416     *  protected void process( BufferedReader input ) throws IOException, SAXException
417     *  {
418     *      ContentHandler handler = getContentHandler();
419     *
420     *      //---* Load the properties *---------------------------------------
421     *      ExtendedProperties properties = new ExtendedProperties();
422     *      properties.load( input );
423     *
424     *      //---* Create the document *---------------------------------------
425     *      handler.startDocument();
426     *      handler.startElement( null, null, "properties", new AttributesImpl() );
427     *
428     *      //---* Process the properties *------------------------------------
429     *      AttributesImpl attributes;
430     *      char [] value;
431     *      // Each property will be treated as a value with the key as its
432     *      // attribute.
433     *      for( String name : properties.stringPropertyNames() )
434     *      {
435     *          //---* Start the element *-------------------------------------
436     *          attributes = new AttributesImpl();
437     *          attributes.addAttribute( null, null, "name", "ID", name );
438     *          handler.startElement( null, null, "property", attributes );
439     *
440     *          //---* The element contents *----------------------------------
441     *          value = properties.getProperty( name ).toCharArray();
442     *          handler.characters( value, 0, value.length );
443     *
444     *          //---* End the element *---------------------------------------
445     *          handler.endElement( null, null, "property" );
446     *      }
447     *
448     *      //---* Finish the document *---------------------------------------
449     *      handler.endElement( null, null, "properties" );
450     *      handler.endDocument();
451     *  }   //  process()
452     *  </code></pre>
453     *
454     *  @param  input   The input stream.
455     *  @throws IOException Problems reading the input stream.
456     *  @throws SAXException    Something has gone wrong.
457     */
458    protected abstract void process( BufferedReader input ) throws IOException, SAXException;
459
460    /**
461     *  Sets the content handler used by this XMLReader. It allows an
462     *  application to register a content event handler.<br>
463     *  <br>If the application does not register a content handler, all
464     *  content events reported by the SAX parser will be silently
465     *  ignored.<br>
466     *  <br>Applications may register a new or different handler in the middle
467     *  of a parse, and the SAX parser must begin using the new handler
468     *  immediately.
469     *
470     *  @param  handler  The content handler; may be {@code null}.
471     *
472     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#setContentHandler(org.xml.sax.ContentHandler)
473     */
474    @Override
475    public final void setContentHandler( final ContentHandler handler )  { m_ContentHandler = handler; }
476
477    /**
478     *  Sets the DTD handler used by this XMLReader. Allows an application to
479     *  register a DTD event handler.<br>
480     *  <br>If the application does not register a DTD handler, all DTD events
481     *  reported by the SAX parser will be silently ignored.<br>
482     *  <br>Applications may register a new or different handler in the middle
483     *  of a parse, and the SAX parser must begin using the new handler
484     *  immediately.
485     *
486     *  @param  handler The DTD handler; may be {@code null}.
487     *
488     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#setDTDHandler(org.xml.sax.DTDHandler)
489     */
490    @Override
491    public final void setDTDHandler( final DTDHandler handler ) { m_DTDHandler = handler; }
492
493    /**
494     *  Sets the encoding for the input source. {@code null} means that
495     *  the platform specific encoding is used.
496     *
497     *  @param  encoding    The encoding to use; may be {@code null}.
498     */
499    public final void setEncoding( final String encoding ) { m_Encoding = encoding; }
500
501    /**
502     *  Sets the entity resolver that is used by this XMLReader. Allows an
503     *  application to register an entity resolver.<br>
504     *  <br>If the application does not register an entity resolver, the
505     *  XMLReader will perform its own default resolution.<br>
506     *  <br>Applications may register a new or different resolver in the
507     *  middle of a parse, and the SAX parser must begin using the new resolver
508     *  immediately.
509     *
510     *  @param  resolver    The entity resolver; may be {@code null}.
511     *
512     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#setEntityResolver(org.xml.sax.EntityResolver)
513     */
514    @Override
515    public final void setEntityResolver( final EntityResolver resolver ) { m_EntityResolver = resolver; }
516
517    /**
518     *  Sets the error handler that is used by this XMLReader. Allows an
519     *  application to register an error event handler.<br>
520     *  <br>If the application does not register an error handler, all error
521     *  events reported by the SAX parser will be written to
522     *  {@link System#err System.err}
523     *  and otherwise silently ignored; however, normal processing may not
524     *  continue. It is highly recommended that all SAX applications implement
525     *  an error handler to avoid unexpected bugs.<br>
526     *  <br>Applications may register a new or different handler in the middle
527     *  of a parse, and the SAX parser must begin using the new handler
528     *  immediately.
529     *
530     *  @param  handler The error handler; may be {@code null}.
531     *
532     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#setErrorHandler(org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler)
533     *  @see DefaultErrorHandler
534     */
535    @Override
536    public final void setErrorHandler( final ErrorHandler handler )
537    {
538        m_ErrorHandler = nonNull( handler ) ? handler : DefaultErrorHandler.INSTANCE;
539    }   //  setErrorHandler()
540
541    /**
542     *  Sets the feature flag.
543     *
544     *  @param  name    The name of the feature.
545     *  @param  value   {@code true} if the feature should be supported
546     *      by this implementation, {@code false} if not.
547     *  @throws SAXNotRecognizedException   The feature value cannot be
548     *      assigned.
549     *  @throws SAXNotSupportedException    The XMLReader recognises the
550     *      feature name but cannot set the requested value.
551     *
552     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#setFeature(java.lang.String, boolean)
553     *  @see #getFeature(String) getFeature()
554     */
555    @Override
556    public void setFeature( final String name, final boolean value ) throws SAXNotRecognizedException, SAXNotSupportedException
557    {
558        m_Features.put( requireNonNullArgument( name, "name" ), Boolean.valueOf( value ) );
559    }   //  setFeature()
560
561    /**
562     *  Sets the current location to the locator.
563     *
564     *  @param  lineNumber   The current line number.
565     *  @param  columnNumber    The current column number.
566     */
567    protected final void setLocation( final int lineNumber, final int columnNumber )
568    {
569        m_Locator.setLineNumber( lineNumber );
570        m_Locator.setColumnNumber( columnNumber );
571    }   //  setLocation()
572
573    /**
574     *  Sets the value of a property. Usually, the property name is any
575     *  fully-qualified URI. It is possible for an XMLReader to recognize a
576     *  property name but to be unable to change the current value. Some
577     *  property values may be immutable or mutable only in specific contexts,
578     *  such as before, during, or after a parse.<br>
579     *  <br>XMLReaders are not required to recognize setting any specific
580     *  property names, though a core set is defined by SAX2. But only this is
581     *  not implemented by this implementation.<br>
582     *  <br>This method is also the standard mechanism for setting extended
583     *  handlers.
584     *
585     *  @param name The property name, which is a fully-qualified URI.
586     *  @param value    The requested value for the property.
587     *  @throws SAXNotRecognizedException   The property value can't be
588     *      assigned or retrieved.
589     *  @throws SAXNotSupportedException    The XMLReader recognises the
590     *      property name but cannot set the requested value.
591     *
592     *  @see org.xml.sax.XMLReader#setProperty(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)
593     *  @see #getProperty(String) getProperty()
594     */
595    @Override
596    public void setProperty( final String name, final Object value ) throws SAXNotRecognizedException, SAXNotSupportedException
597    {
598        requireNonNullArgument( name, "name" );
599        if( nonNull( value ) )
600        {
601            m_Properties.put( name, value );
602        }
603        else
604        {
605            m_Properties.remove( name );
606        }
607    }   //  setProperty()
608
609    /**
610     *  Sets the public id to the locator.
611     *
612     *  @param  publicId    The value for the public id; may be {@code null}.
613     */
614    protected final void setPublicId( final String publicId ) { m_Locator.setPublicId( publicId ); }
615
616    /**
617     *  Sets the system id to the locator.
618     *
619     *  @param  systemId    The value for the system id; may be {@code null}.
620     */
621    protected final void setSystemId( final String systemId ) { m_Locator.setSystemId( systemId ); }
622}
623//  class AbstractXMLReader
624
625/*
626 *  End of File
627 */
